overview_summary: All four profiled neighbors have no documented stance on the proposed development or clean energy projects. None are known to hold public office or lead community organizations, suggesting generally low public influence among this group. Most appear to be private landowners without a visible role in local civic affairs.

neighbors.name: Robert Bennett
neighbors.claims: Robert Bennett is identified as a local landowner but does not appear in any recent Mayes County public meetings or news archives ([mayesrwd5.com](https://mayesrwd5.com/minutes#:~:text=Minutes%20,PDF%20%2F%20114%20KB)). No evidence of Bennett taking a public stance on development or participating in civic groups could be found as of this report ([mayesrwd5.com](https://mayesrwd5.com/minutes#:~:text=Minutes%20,PDF%20%2F%20114%20KB)).
neighbors.influence_justification: No public offices or known activism

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach through a friendly personal visit via a mutual acquaintance, focusing on listening to any concerns. With no known stance, a neighborly conversation to explain the project and answer questions would help gauge his perspective.

neighbors.name: Stephen W & Marsha E Spencer
neighbors.claims: Stephen and Marsha Spencer are relatively new to Mayes County, having relocated from the Raleigh, North Carolina area to Chouteau, OK around 2018 ([besthistorysites.net](https://besthistorysites.net/name/marsha-spencer#:~:text=392%20Pryor%20Creek%20Rd%2C%20Chouteau%2C,current%20address)). They have no recorded history of involvement in local boards or development debates since moving to Oklahoma ([besthistorysites.net](https://besthistorysites.net/name/marsha-spencer#:~:text=Marsha%20E%20Spencer%20is%20a,1%20email%20address%20we%20found)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Welcome the Spencers with a one-on-one meeting facilitated by a community liaison. Emphasize transparency about the development plans and invite their questions, since they are newer residents without established views.

neighbors.name: Patrick J & Donna L Bannister
neighbors.claims: Patrick J. Bannister, born in 1957 and now 68 years old, resides with his wife Donna on Pryor Creek Loop in Chouteau, Oklahoma ([www.menstoppingviolence.org](https://www.menstoppingviolence.org/people/patrick-bannister/#:~:text=Patrick%20Bannister%20was%20born%20on,person%20has%206%20family%20members)) ([www.menstoppingviolence.org](https://www.menstoppingviolence.org/people/patrick-bannister/#:~:text=600%20Pryor%20Creek%20Loop%2C%20Chouteau%2C,person%20has%206%20family%20members)). He has lived at that address since at least 2014 after previously residing at numerous addresses in several other cities ([www.menstoppingviolence.org](https://www.menstoppingviolence.org/people/patrick-bannister/#:~:text=600%20Pryor%20Creek%20Loop%2C%20Chouteau%2C,person%20has%206%20family%20members)). There is no public record of Bannister taking an active role in local government or advocacy on development issues ([www.menstoppingviolence.org](https://www.menstoppingviolence.org/people/patrick-bannister/#:~:text=Patrick%20Bannister%20was%20born%20on,person%20has%206%20family%20members)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Bannisters via a trusted local friend or neighbor to start a respectful dialogue. With no known public stance, an informal conversation addressing any questions about land use or property impacts can help build trust and understand their concerns.

neighbors.name: William T Keirsey
neighbors.claims: William T. “Tommy” Keirsey, born in Pryor in 1936 to local parents Bryan and Daisy Keirsey, passed away in September 2018 ([www.moorefuneral.com](https://www.moorefuneral.com/m/obituaries/william-keirsey/MemorialMedias#:~:text=October%2010%2C%201936%20,4%2C%202018)). He had a twenty-year career in the U.S. Air Force and was living in Tulsa at the time of his death, although land in Mayes County remained in his name ([www.moorefuneral.com](https://www.moorefuneral.com/m/obituaries/william-keirsey/MemorialMedias#:~:text=William%20T.%20,View%20Obituary%20%26%20Service%20Information)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Elderly owner; family holds legacy land

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with Keirsey’s family or estate representative through a community leader who knows them. Emphasize respect for the family’s long legacy with the land and discuss how the development plans can align with preserving that heritage.
